name: asthma
overview: Asthma is a long-term disease of the lungs that causes your airways to become inflamed and narrowed, leading to difficulty breathing. It can be triggered by allergens, exercise, cold air, or respiratory infections.
diagnosed_by: Doctors can usually diagnose asthma through a combination of medical history review, physical examination, and pulmonary function tests such as spirometry.

name: diabetes
overview: Diabetes is a chronic metabolic disorder where the body either does not produce enough insulin or cannot effectively use the insulin it produces, leading to elevated levels of blood glucose.
diagnosed_by: Your doctor can diagnose diabetes by reviewing your symptoms and performing blood tests such as fasting blood glucose, A1C test, or oral glucose tolerance test.

name: appendicitis
overview: Appendicitis is the acute inflammation of the appendix, a finger-like pouch attached to the large intestine, often requiring surgical removal to prevent rupture and infection.
how_common: Affects about 1 in 20 people over their lifetime.
diagnosed_by: Doctors typically diagnose appendicitis by performing a physical examination and ordering imaging tests like an abdominal ultrasound or CT scan to detect inflammation.

name: bronchitis
overview: Bronchitis involves inflammation of the bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from your lungs. It is usually caused by viruses or irritants like tobacco smoke and pollution.
how_common: Very common, especially acute bronchitis during cold seasons.
diagnosed_by: Bronchitis is usually diagnosed by listening to your lungs with a stethoscope, and if needed, conducting a chest X-ray or sputum test to rule out pneumonia.

name: cancer
overview: Cancer encompasses a broad group of diseases characterized by uncontrolled cell growth that can invade nearby tissues and spread to other parts of the body.
how_common: One of the leading causes of death worldwide.
diagnosed_by: Cancer diagnosis depends on the type and may include imaging tests, blood tests, and biopsies to examine tissue samples for abnormal cell growth.

name: chronic heart disease
overview: Chronic heart disease includes a range of long-standing conditions that impair the heart’s structure and function, often resulting in reduced blood flow and heart failure over time.
how_common: Affects millions globally; a leading cause of death.
diagnosed_by: Doctors diagnose chronic heart disease using electrocardiograms (ECG), echocardiograms, stress tests, and sometimes coronary angiography to assess blood flow and heart function.

name: cirrhosis of the liver
overview: Cirrhosis is the advanced scarring of the liver tissue caused by prolonged liver damage. It significantly impacts liver function and can lead to life-threatening complications.
how_common: Common among people with chronic liver disease or alcohol abuse.
diagnosed_by: To diagnose cirrhosis, doctors typically conduct blood tests to evaluate liver function, followed by imaging studies or a liver biopsy to confirm scarring.

name: gallstones
overview: Gallstones are solid particles that form in the gallbladder from bile cholesterol and bilirubin, and may cause pain, infection, or blockages in the digestive tract.
how_common: Affects 10–15% of adults in developed countries.
diagnosed_by: Doctors diagnose gallstones by performing an abdominal ultrasound or CT scan. Blood tests may be done to check for infection or bile duct blockage.

name: hepatitis
overview: Hepatitis refers to liver inflammation caused by viruses, alcohol use, or autoimmune conditions. It can lead to liver damage, cirrhosis, or liver cancer.
how_common: Hundreds of millions affected globally (especially hepatitis B and C).
diagnosed_by: Hepatitis can be diagnosed through liver function blood tests and a viral hepatitis panel to detect specific virus types like hepatitis A, B, or C.

name: hypertension
overview: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition in which the force of the blood against your artery walls is consistently too high, often without noticeable symptoms.
how_common: Affects more than 1 billion people worldwide.
diagnosed_by: Your doctor can diagnose hypertension simply by taking your blood pressure using a cuff and stethoscope over several visits to confirm elevated readings.

name: ischemic heart disease
overview: Ischemic heart disease, also called coronary artery disease, occurs when the heart's blood supply is blocked or interrupted by a build-up of fatty substances in the coronary arteries.
how_common: The leading cause of death globally.
diagnosed_by: Doctors use tests like ECG, stress tests, and coronary angiography to diagnose ischemic heart disease and evaluate the severity of blood flow reduction.

name: migraine
overview: Migraine is a neurological condition marked by recurring moderate to severe headaches, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
diagnosed_by: Migraine is typically diagnosed based on medical history, symptoms, and physical examination. In some cases, imaging may be done to rule out other causes.

name: pneumonia
overview: Pneumonia is a lung infection that causes inflammation in the air sacs, filling them with fluid or pus. It can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
how_common: Very common, especially in children and the elderly.
diagnosed_by: Doctors can diagnose pneumonia by reviewing your symptoms, listening to your lungs with a stethoscope, and confirming with a chest X-ray or sputum culture.

name: tuberculosis
overview: Tuberculosis (TB) is a highly contagious bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs but can also impact other parts of the body.
how_common: Affects millions annually, especially in low-income countries.
diagnosed_by: TB is diagnosed using a skin test (Mantoux), chest X-rays, and sputum tests to detect Mycobacterium tuberculosis in the lungs.

name: ulcer
overview: An ulcer is a painful sore in the lining of the stomach or small intestine, typically caused by bacterial infection or long-term use of anti-inflammatory drugs.
diagnosed_by: Doctors diagnose ulcers using an upper endoscopy to view the stomach lining. They may also test for H. pylori infection or perform a barium swallow X-ray.
